channel.title: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified
channel.description: when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified plz help what i do ? :confused:

item.title: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @cricket1 cricket :)
item.description:
@cricket1 wrote:

change where it says ‘java’ to “C:/Program Files/Java/jre1.6.0_YOUR VERSION/bin/java.exe”

keep the quotes, and change where it says your version to the extension on your jre version

Read full topic
item.source: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified

item.title: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @i_love_moparscape1 i love moparscape1
item.description:
@i_love_moparscape1 wrote:

now im confused wat do i do where can i download java jdk 6?

item.source: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified

item.title: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“adamhelloman8, post:2, topic:257940”]One way that will work, but is incorrect, is:

Go to computer/my computer

Go to system properties

Go to Advanced system properties

Go to environmental variables

In the system variables list, find path. Put this as the value

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;

Once fixed, press new

for variable name, put CLASSPATH

For value, put this code

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Press ok, and now try and run your server. If this error still continues, be sure to have download JDK 6 update 11.[/quote]

lol?? you ment to add them in the top or ipconfig doesnt work.

Read full topic

item.source: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified

item.title: Help when i run server it says the system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @adamhelloman8 adamhelloman8
item.description:
@adamhelloman8 wrote:

One way that will work, but is incorrect, is:

Go to computer/my computer

Go to system properties

Go to Advanced system properties

Go to environmental variables

In the system variables list, find path. Put this as the value

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;

Once fixed, press new

for variable name, put CLASSPATH

For value, put this code

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Press ok, and now try and run your server. If this error still continues, be sure to have download JDK 6 update 11.

Read full topic
